title: Why August could be a tough month for stocks
text: Markets (^GSPC, ^IXIC, ^DJI) often show weaker performance in August with modest returns and low positive days since 1990. Yahoo Finance Markets and Data Editor Jared Blikre, who also hosts Yahoo Finance's Stocks in Translation podcast, breaks down how seasonal trends and the US dollar's (DX=F, DX-Y.NYB) strength could impact stocks through October.

title: The Newest Trait Investors Love In Tech Stocks? No Profit
text: It's the time of the year S&P 500 companies report their quarterly profit. Ironically, tech investors jump on shares of companies losing money.

title: The stock market's worst month is coming up. Should you sell in August?
text: September typically is a loser. August's return depends on the index you track.

title: Dow Futures trade mixed today: 5 things to know before Wall Street opens
text: Dow Futures were modestly higher early Monday, up by as much as 40 points before the open. The broader market is coming off a strong session, both the S&P 500 and Nasdaq notched fresh record closes, while the Dow ended just shy of its December 2024 high, down less than a quarter percent.

title: Nick: Tech remains resilient amid economic slowdown
text: Brian Nick, Head of Portfolio Strategy at NewEdge Wealth, tells Worldwide Exchange that despite signs of market froth, tech remains resilient as recession fears ease and earnings stay solid.

title: Field: Investors are breathing a sigh of relief at the 15% tariff level
text: Emily Field, Barclays head of European pharma research, tells Worldwide Exchange tariffs bring relief at 15%, but risks like shortages and pricing still weigh on the sector.

title: Shooting at NYC building housing Wall Street firms, NFL HQ leaves 5 dead

title: Consumers brace for higher grocery bills as Trump's tariffs loom
text: US President Donald Trump's new blanket tariffs are scheduled to take effect on August 1, a move that experts warn could lead to increased prices on various food items for American consumers, according to a CNBC report.

title: Former Dallas Fed Pres. Robert Kaplan: There are a number of disinflationary forces going on
text: Robert Kaplan, Goldman Sachs vice chairman and former Dallas Fed president, joins 'Squawk Box' to discuss the Fed's two-day policy meeting this week, what to expect from Fed Chair Powell's commentary, state of the economy, rate path outlook, and more.

title: Trump's Trade Victories Could Be Hollow. Why Markets Must Be Wary of China Talks.

title: The Day Ahead: Markets Brace for Earnings and Fed Signals in Busy Trading Today
text: Markets today edge higher as traders await Fed decision, key data prints, and a wave of earnings from major S&P 500 firms.

title: Fed's policy toolkit may be headed for fundamental changes
text: A U.S. senator's recent push to strip the Federal Reserve of a key aspect of how it controls interest rates and the battle over who will succeed Fed Chair Jerome Powell point to a future where some of the tools policymakers use to influence the economy come under greater scrutiny.

title: Pharma giants push for tariff clarity as ambiguity threatens EU-U.S. deal
text: Ambiguity abounds around the terms for pharmaceutical goods under the U.S.-EU trade truce agreed Sunday. Pharma firms are urging clarity over whether their products will be subject to 15% tariffs on EU goods imported to the U.S.

title: A look at the policymakers who get an equal say on each Federal Reserve interest-rate decision
text: Jerome Powell has been President Trump's No. 1 target as Trump demands lower interest rates, but other policymakers are also part of each rate decision.

title: Capital Account: Trump has hit his tariff goals, for now. But these deals don't yet represent a new trade order.
text: The tariff deals are sort of a way station, more fragile and with less legitimacy than the system they have supplanted.
